page.title: 16SPORTING PURSUITS, SEAFORD
page.content: THERE ARE{MANY SPORTS CLUBS}IN SEAFORD. FOR OUTDOOR WINTER GAMES MANY YOUNG MEN BELONG TO THE{FOOTBALL, {RUGBY}OR{HOCKEY}CLUBS. THE{CRICKET CLUB MEET ON SUMMER SUNDAYS.{STOOLBALL IS A SUSSEX GAME WHICH IS QUITE POPULAR LOCALLY. THE{TENNIS}CLUB HAS MANY MEMBERS SOME OF WHOM ALSO PLAY IN ONE OF THE THREE{BADMINTON}CLUBS.{GOLF IS ENJOYED ON THE PUBLIC COURSE AT SEAFORD HEAD AND IN THE PRIVATE CLUB AT BLATCHINGTON.{BOWLS}IS PLAYED MAINLY BY OLDER PEOPLE ON THE CLUB'S GREENS.{JUDO, KARATE AND BOXING}CLUBS TEACH SELF DEFENCE TO YOUNG PEOPLE. PROXIMITY TO THE SEA MAKES {WATER {SPORTS POPULAR; SAILING, ANGLING AND {CANOE CLUBS}MEET REGULARLY.{SWIMMING GROUPS USE SCHOOL POOLS AND{THE {SEAFORD LIFE-GUARDS}MEET WEEKLY FOR TRAINING TO ENABLE THEM TO PATROL THE BEACH IN SUMMER. {
